intro: Phragmanthera nigritana var. obovata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phragmanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its obovate leaves, which are broad at the tip and taper toward the base. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
